body.p: The collection catalogued in 1878 comprised MSS. Ch. Lincs. 1-20 and MS. Rolls Lincs. 1, of unrecorded provenance. Some items (Ch. 6, 11, 12) can be identified in the collection of Ralph Thoresby, for which see the collection overview for Yorkshire.

The major later accessions include:
MSS. Ch. Lincs. 26-137: Healey family deeds related to Ashby and Burringham, 15th-17th century (see also MSS. Ch. London and Middlesex 218-223, Norfolk 761, Sussex 326, Yorks. 350-3, and Summary Catalogue appendix II )
MSS. Ch. Lincs. 138-181: New College leases (see the collection overview for Berkshire)
MSS. Ch. Lincs. 182-384: Amcotts and Kettlethorpe deeds, 13th-17th century (see also MSS. Ch. Camb. 181, Derb. 24, Notts. 27-35, Salop. 103, Yorks. 354; Summary Catalogue appendix II )
MSS. Ch. Lincs. 386-571, 1220-80, MSS. Rolls Lincs. 55-69: given by Miss M. Peacock in 1921, together with MSS. Ch. Yorks. 367-516, Derbs. 36, 42-52, Dorset 13, Glouc. 139, Hants. 178, Herts 32-6, Kent 383-7, Lancs. 18, London and Middlesex 371, Northants. 13-16 (?), Notts. 49-53, Warws. 49-53, Foreign 6-9 (Summary Catalogue 52106-20).
MSS. Ch. Lincs. 573-1219, 1281-1351, 1367-76, Rolls Lincs. 3-54: deeds of the Hussey family of Honington and Doddington, given by the trustees of the estate of the Marquis of Waterford c. 1920-5 (see also MSS. Ch. Berks. 753, Devon 40-1, Essex 976-80, Gloucs. 138, London and Middlesex 365-70, Northants. 30-3, Notts. 36-48, Somerset 80, Staffs. 70-1, Sussex 328-9, Worcs. 31-71, Yorks. 358-85; Summary Catalogue 54418-503).
